rev.comment: /* Ethics of Necrophilia */ seems unnecessary to say vehemently - in what way were they vehemently challenged?; case
rev.diff:
Line 84: Line 84:
Wisconsin--(According to website reports) On July 9, 2008, this US state has passed state law against Necrophilia in light of the Laura Tennessen case. It is punishable by up to 10 years in prison.
Wisconsin--(According to website reports) On July 9, 2008, this US state has passed state law against Necrophilia in light of the Laura Tennessen case. It is punishable by up to 10 years in prison.
â
==Ethics of Necrophilia==
+
==Ethics of necrophilia==
It has been argued that necrophilia may not be unethical as is widely believed. The argument given in favor is that the human body is like an aircraft, which is inhabited by the pilot (the soul). The pilot is one which matters. Once pilot has deserted the aircraft, nobody can really do anything unethical against the aircraft.<ref name="McKearn">McKearn, S. Dead Sexy: An Essay on the Ethics of Necrophilia. ''Anil Aggrawal's Internet Journal of Forensic Medicine and Toxicology'' [serial online], 2008; Vol. '''9''', No. 2 (July - December 2008): [about 15 p]. Available from: http://www.geradts.com/anil/ij/vol_009_no_002/papers/paper002.html. Published : July 1, 2008, (Accessed: July 16, 2008)</ref>. A further argument is that when a number of non-consensual invasions of the dead body through body orifices, including the vagina - as in embalming - are considered perfectly ethical, why exclude necrophilia only and on which grounds.<ref name="McKearn">McKearn, S. Dead Sexy: An Essay on the Ethics of Necrophilia. '''Anil Aggrawal's Internet Journal of Forensic Medicine and Toxicology''' [serial online], 2008; Vol. '''9''', No. 2 (July - December 2008): [about 15 p]. Available from: http://www.geradts.com/anil/ij/vol_009_no_002/papers/paper002.html. Published : July 1, 2008, (Accessed: July 16, 2008)</ref>
It has been argued that necrophilia may not be unethical as is widely believed. The argument given in favor is that the human body is like an aircraft, which is inhabited by the pilot (the soul). The pilot is one which matters. Once pilot has deserted the aircraft, nobody can really do anything unethical against the aircraft.<ref name="McKearn">McKearn, S. Dead Sexy: An Essay on the Ethics of Necrophilia. ''Anil Aggrawal's Internet Journal of Forensic Medicine and Toxicology'' [serial online], 2008; Vol. '''9''', No. 2 (July - December 2008): [about 15 p]. Available from: http://www.geradts.com/anil/ij/vol_009_no_002/papers/paper002.html. Published : July 1, 2008, (Accessed: July 16, 2008)</ref>. A further argument is that when a number of non-consensual invasions of the dead body through body orifices, including the vagina - as in embalming - are considered perfectly ethical, why exclude necrophilia only and on which grounds.<ref name="McKearn">McKearn, S. Dead Sexy: An Essay on the Ethics of Necrophilia. '''Anil Aggrawal's Internet Journal of Forensic Medicine and Toxicology''' [serial online], 2008; Vol. '''9''', No. 2 (July - December 2008): [about 15 p]. Available from: http://www.geradts.com/anil/ij/vol_009_no_002/papers/paper002.html. Published : July 1, 2008, (Accessed: July 16, 2008)</ref>
â
This view however has been vehemently challenged by others.<ref name="Benecke">Benecke, M. Clandestine Necrophilia - Probably Legal, Still A Problem. ''Anil Aggrawal's Internet Journal of Forensic Medicine and Toxicology'' [serial online], 2008; Vol. '''9''', No. 2 (July - December 2008): [about 5 p]. Available from: http://www.geradts.com/anil/ij/vol_009_no_002/papers/paper003.html. Published : July 1, 2008, (Accessed: July 16, 2008)</ref>
+
This view however has been challenged by others.<ref name="Benecke">Benecke, M. Clandestine Necrophilia - Probably Legal, Still A Problem.
